page.title: 04Read's Farm,Carisbrooke.
page.content: Read's Farm is a well kept{dairy}farm of 81 hectares. It has a herd of l70 cattle, l00 of which are dairy cows. The farm is run by the farmer and just two other workers. Read's Farm has absorbed the fields of two other farms, Cook's Farm and Green Park Farm. Cook's Farm is now a private house, and Green Park Farm is derelict. Nearly all the fields are used for growing grass, and the cattle remain in the fields until the end of October. They are then moved into the sheds and fed on protein and silage for the winter. The farmer has to produce enough silage from his fields to last until Spring. The dairy cattle yield about{l800 litres of milk}each day, according to season. The milk is collected daily and sent to Newport and then, Guildford.
